body.name: Pink Gaming Keyboard, 104 Keys All-Metal Panel, Rainbow LED Backlit Quiet Creamy Keyboard, Wrist Rest, PBT Keycaps, Anti-ghosting, Light Up USB Wired Computer Keyboard for PC Mac Xbox
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 7 hrs
features: 🎀【LED Backlit Light Up Keyboard】There are 2 illumination modes and 3 brightness levels to choose from. ☼: Static backlight/off; FN+☼: Dynamic backlight. Fn+PgUp: Increase brightness; Fn+PgDn: Decrease brightness. FN+ /-: Adjust the speed of the dynamic backlight. (𝐍𝐨𝐭𝐞: 𝐎𝐧𝐥𝐲 𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐛𝐨𝐰 𝐛𝐚𝐜𝐤𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐛𝐞 𝐚𝐝𝐣𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐨 𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐥𝐞-𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐫 𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭).

🎀【PBT Pudding Keycaps】These keycaps feature a unique "pudding" design with a translucent outer layer, resulting in a clearer and softer backlighting effect compared to regular keycaps. The PBT keycaps maintain their original texture even after extensive use, ensuring they are resistant to fading and wear.

🎀【Durable Metal Panel Pink Keyboard】This rainbow backlit keyboard is designed with an aluminum alloy panel, which not only improves the overall texture of the USB keyboard but also greatly improves the durability and water resistance. At the same time, there are 4 drainage holes at the bottom of the led keyboard, you don't worry about spilled liquids that will damage the computer keyboard.

🎀【Ergonomic Design with Wrist Rest】This creamy keyboard features a scientific stepped keycap design, maximizing hand comfort during extended gaming or work sessions. It also provides an ergonomic typing angle (7°) and wrist support. All keys offer a soft touch, without loud clicking noises, allowing for late-night typing or gaming without disturbing others.

🎀【Multimedia & Anti-Ghosting】With 12 multimedia keys, enhance your gaming operations or work efficiency. The 19 anti-ghosting keys ensure that every keystroke is registered without any loss, ensuring smooth typing. You can swap the WSAD keys with the arrow keys by pressing FN+W and lock/unlock the WIN key by pressing N+WIN. (𝐍𝐨𝐭𝐞: 𝐌𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐚 𝐤𝐞𝐲𝐬 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐌𝐚𝐜).

🎀【Lifetime After-Sales Guarantee】 If you encounter any issues with the Dacoity wired keyboard, including but not limited to keycap fading, key malfunction, non-operation, 𝐰𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐬𝐞 𝐚 𝟏𝟎𝟎% 𝐫𝐞𝐟𝐮𝐧𝐝 𝐨𝐫 𝐫𝐞𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐜𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭. Please get in touch with us, and our service team will provide you with a satisfactory response within 12 hours.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Spill-Resistant and Durable There are 4 drainage holes on the bottom of this keyboard to effectively prevent water from splashing. The keycaps are also removable for easy cleaning.
PBT Pudding Keycaps The unique "pudding" design features a translucent outer layer that allows vibrant RGB lighting to shine through. Create a visually stunning keyboard setup that stands out.
Game All Night: Illuminate Your Victory Fuel Your Inspiration: Harness the Magic of Pink.

What are the differences or upgrades between this pink version of the keyboard and the black version? This pink keyboard utilizes keycaps made of PBT material, featuring a semi-transparent design that enhances light transmission with a softer glow. Moreover, these keycaps are more durable and resistant to wear, ensuring long-lasting performance. Is this a mechanical keyboard? How loud is this keyboard? It’s a membrane keyboard. It's relatively quiet it only makes noise if you're pressing keys rapidly and hard. Is there a way to set this keyboard to just one color? There are only three modes, which are light off, light on and breathing effect. You can control the speed of the breathing effect. Can this keyboard change the switches? No, it can't. This is a membrane keyboard, not a mechanical keyboard, so the switches cannot be replaced. However, the keycaps can be removed for cleaning. Is this keyboard suitable for gaming? Certainly, it can be used for gaming, but I would recommend it more for everyday office use or as a decorative addition to your workspace.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exceeded my expectations, great first keyboard and mouse!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mouse and keyboard for my first ever gaming PC that I built. I wasn't interested in buying a top of the line product so I just went with a cheap $30 option. I'm very impressed with this! It feels so premium for the price.I love the mouse, it's smooth to touch and easy to use. I love the keyboard keys, they aren't loud to type on and feel nice to press. The lights on the keyboard are very eye pleasing to look at and you can turn them off to conserve power at the press of a button. The brightness is just fine and don't need to be brighter. Overall I have zero issues with this keyboard and mouse combo, it's definitely worth having. It really made me happy when my gaming PC powered on for the first time and this keyboard and mouse was there to make that experience even more exciting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Keyboard Ever!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this keyboard when my MX keys (warranty replacement) stopped working after 6 months and then purchased the MX keys Mechanical keyboard (2 weeks ago) and no matter what I did I could not get 2 of my 3 computers to recognize it. Totally frustrated when Logitech ignored my support tickets, emails and messages. I decided to pack it back up and return it. That is when I discovered the Dacoity Gaming Keyboard. On a hunch that it was going to be a winner, I ordered Two of them which arrived 6 hours later in perfect condition. My first observation after unpacking it was it's solid feel, metal plating and perfect sized keys. Then I plugged it in to my computer and it came to life, Instantly I was overwhelmed with the colored backlighting and the feeling it gave me while typing. I didn't need to search for instructions anywhere like its overpriced competitors. It was off the races for me and performed so well that I cleared the backlog created while I was trying to get my brand new $185.00 Logitech Mechanic to work was quickly taken care of. If you are on the fence I suggest you buy one or two and see how you feel about everything I have said not to mention you could have 8 of these for the same price as 1 super techy overpriced keyboard which couldn't even connect with all its dongles, drivers, software and lack of support. LOGITECH (BAD) and DACOITY (GOOD). Gotta go buy a few more for the future.Stay Safe,Peter DNY

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars good for its price
reviews.reviewText: context: this is the first dedicated keyboard ive purchased thats not a POS used keyboard for 5$.for a mid 30$ keyboard, i didnt know what to expect but this is nice. actually what im typing this review with. bought this because the 5$ goodwill keybaord i was using sucked ass to type on, and i needed something better. this is a very nice feeling keybaord, the pressure to ge tthe keys to actuate is satisfyingly high but you dont get fatigued from it after typing up multipage college papers. the backlight button was one i did remove, as i kept accidantally hitting it, but i like the backlight set at its dimmest setting. pretty colors, and not so bright its distracting. also, the legends on the keys themselves are nicly backlit with the only downside being around the dark blue region (so, the insert/home/pageup/scroll lock/num lock region of the keyboard that you never use anyway without first looking to see what key your hitting because NOBODY USES PAGE UP LOL)really the only downside of this is the height of the keys could be half what it currently is, or less. the keys sit almost 1/2" above the main body of the keyboard to allow the light diffusing plate to, well, diffuse the backlight. its pretty to look at, but makes the overall ergonomics of this keybaord worse. not so bad im getting rid of this, but bad enough that long term im making a custom wrist rest to raise my hands to the right level.also the metal frame construction is nice. sheds liquids well, same for dirt/dust. easy to clean out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected!
reviews.reviewText: I love my mechanical keyboard but I needed something quieter. I didn’t feel like paying the $120+ for a high end name. When I saw this, and read the reviews, I had to give it a try.First the RGB is just as bright as my other one, but it’s not as customizable. Well I only paid $30 for this one so I’m okay with that.Second, it’s quiet, really quieter than I had expected. I still feel like I’m pressing keys, I just don’t have the loud clicks. Very happy with it.Last but not least, this thing feels really solid. Good heavy metal construction, really well thought out, and it feels like it should have cost 2x maybe 3x as much.The only cons for me would be the wrist rest, there is a slight rest built into it and it’s very comfortable. I just have a preference for a larger rest. Beyond that the USB cable feels flimsy. Again I paid like $30 for the kb and it’s not a huge issue in my opinion.Bottom line, it works, it looks good, it feels good, and you really cannot beat the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars not a gamer but great keyboard
reviews.reviewText: The prefect shade if pink! I dont game so i couldnt say how well it does for gaming, but for online shopping and emails it works great! not to loud. i like the clicking sound though so could be loud to other people lol. lights are cool too cant change colors that im aware of think its just the 4 colors in a row. like that it turns off though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Budget Keyboard
reviews.reviewText: Excellent keyboard for the price. Have not had any issues with it. Perfect amount of light, feel, and comfort. PLus the aluminum top plate looks cool and it is easy to clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple, cheap, reliable keyboard.
reviews.reviewText: No complaints at all! Decent keyboard with no significant or otherwise glaring issues. You very much get what you pay for - though the metallic construction is extremely nice. Time will tell how long this keyboard will last, but there have been no issues thus far.

This product is simply outstanding. Not being a gamer I do not care about the usual gaming features. But I guess the Dacoity keyboard could be as well used for gaming. Lighting effects are simple but nice; I like to work with this keyboard at night, my desk lamp switched off. I must say I love it. First of all, for mechanical keyboard it is truly quiet. The keys feel great - typing is a pleasure. Unlike in many other keyboards, this one's keys do not become greasy (you will know what I mean if you ever used Razer or Redragon keyboards including the more expensive ones). It is very sturdy and feels satisfactorily solid. Everything works out of the box; you do not need to install any additional software, which always slows down your machine (I will admit I tried several software-driven and software-controlled gaming keyboards, and I invariably found them cumbersome and their software invasive). The Dacoity keyboard works, feels and looks like a much more expensive product. In this price range it is unbeatable. I bought one and when I realised how good it was, I purchased another. Get it while it is still cheap - and available. Like me, you will be a very happy camper!

Clairement un clavier parfait pour les gamers avec des lumieres et touches configurable.Je stream souvent et j'ai des touches qui font offices de stream deck. Configuration facile ! Clavier marche parfaitement et ne s'entend pas sur le stream !

Premetto che non la uso per giocare ma per scrivere. Non la giudico pertanto come tastiera gaming e non sono in grado di dire se può essere valida anche a questo scopo. Come tastiera da scrittura per il prezzo è molto conveniente. Ha molte qualità e pochi difetti. Ha una retroilluminazione molto efficace e un po' "appariscente". Ma per quel che mi riguarda è efficace, ben visibile e la luminosità si può impostare su tre gradazioni diverse. E' molto silenziosa. Ha dei tasti che a differenza di molte tastiere anche più costose non dovrebbero scolorirsi (come è dichiarato esplicitamente dal produttore). E' una tastiera italiana vera, senza strane combinazioni di tasti. Tutto è dove dovrebbe essere. Veniamo poi ai peccati veniali: un aspetto fastidioso è che l'accensione della retroilluminazione è devoluta a un grosso tasto posto in prima fila. Quindi facilissimo premerlo per sbaglio. Personalmente ho risolto mettendo una piccola "zeppa" sotto il tasto così da non poterlo schiacciare. E' d'altronde del tutto superfluo perché la retroilluminazione è attivabile anche con la combinazione fn + pag dw e up. Per chi scrive con dieci dita come me l'escursione dei tasti non è brevissima ma questo può anche essere un vantaggio perché obbliga a premere bene ogni tasto evitando così battute accidentali. La tastiera è robustissima perché montata su un telaio interamente di metallo. I tasti (se ho ben capito ma non ho provato) sono anche removibili per una eventuale pulizia profonda. Ha il tasto invio a "L" rovesciata ed è quindi molto comodo, ha una barra spaziatrice che affonda senza piegarsi solo da un lato. Non necessita di pile perché viene alimentata dalla USB. Insomma a questo prezzo cosa volete di più?

Use it for both gaming and school, so it gets probably 50+ hours a week of use.The good: Keys have a nice click and smooth return. It looks really nice and the RGB lighting works really well, lighting brightness is easily adjustable and can be turned on and off with one button.The bad: The black paint has already started wearing off on the palm rest where I resy my palms, showing the gray underneath. I've only owned it about 4 months.Overall a good product for the price. Might try permanent marker or something to touch up the palms rest as it wears off...

This keyboard is solid. It's heavy so it doesn't slide around. The buttons feel good and are super responsive. Also, the keyboard is super quiet. The lighting is super bright as well.Even though it's price is low, the value feels high. I'll buy a backup because I like it that much.
